intro: Maieta hirta, commonly known as the hairy mayweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 centimeters and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom from June to August, followed by cylindrical, hairy seed pods. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, along roadsides, and in waste areas. Maieta hirta is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
